topic.title: Data Source Explorer View (Native XML Databases)

keywords.indexterm: Native XML Databases (NXD)resource managementData Source Explorer view

body.p: The Data Source Explorer view displays your database connections. You can connect to a database simply by expanding the connection node. supports multiple simultaneous database connections and the connection tree provides an easy method for browsing them.

The objects (nodes) that are displayed in the Data Source Explorer view depend on the connection type and structure of the database. Various contextual menu actions are available for each hierarchical level and for some connections you can add or move resources in a container by simply dragging them from the Project view, a file browsing application, or another database.

section.title: Toolbar Actions
section.p:
The following actions are available in the toolbar of the Data Source Explorer view:
Filters Opens the Data Sources / Table Filters preferences page that allows you to decide which table types are displayed in the Data Source Explorer view.
Configure Database Sources Opens the Data Sources preferences page where you can configure both data sources and connections.

section.title: Database-Specific Contextual Menu Actions
section.p: Each specific type of database will also include its own specific contextual menu actions in the Data Source Explorer view. The actions depend on the type of database, the type of node, or the hierarchical level of the node in which the contextual menu is invoked.
For more information on the specific actions that are available, see the topics in this section for each specific type of database.
